conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine acceleration direction.
Graph shows velocity on y-axis and time on x-axis; velocity increases from 0 to 20 m/s between 0 and 10 seconds.
Slope of v-t graph represents acceleration; positive slope indicates positive acceleration.
From 0 to 10 seconds, velocity increases from 0 to 20 m/s; slope is positive.
Positive slope means acceleration is positive; velocity is increasing in positive direction.
Since velocity is increasing in positive direction, acceleration is also in positive direction.
Skydiver is accelerating due to gravity, which acts downward.
Positive slope for skydiver means velocity is increasing in direction of gravity.
Direction of acceleration during 0 to 10 seconds interval is downward.
